summary.title: CPE Project II
summary.description: Completion and final presentation of the senior project begun in the fall. Regular progress reports are required and a formal presentation is required at the end of the academic year. This presentation occurs in front of students, departmental faculty, and invited guests (including potential employers).

course-outcomes.outcome: Develop a significantly complex computer based system that employs both hardware and software.
Engage in brainstorming, research, specification development, prototype development, analysis, testing, and implementation.
Manage a project including scheduling, budgeting, purchasing, generating status reports, and working on a team.
Prepare and deliver clear and understandable oral presentations with effective use of visual aids.
Distinguish between quality and inferiority, and between being on schedule and being behind schedule.
Identify processes and procedures that should lead to continuous improvement if adhered to.
Document a complex system including the creation of a users manual and the maintenance of a project notebook, and a project web site.

laboratory-studio-outcomes.summary: Most of the laboratory time is to provide the students the time to execute their projects as they see fit. A few laboratory periods are used for instructional demonstrations, group activities, or presentation rehearsal. The instructors make themselves available for consultation on hardware, software, interfacing, or systems issues during the laboratory time.
